definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: leave, forsake, loose (NH id. (rare); Ar. 9azaba be remote, absent, depart, As. ezêbu, leave, Shaph. ušezib, rescue, cf. BAram. [[שֵׁיזֵב]];—Eth. m40sab: widowed Di:973);—
leave, c. acc. (on order of meanings cf. Nö:ZMG. xl (1886). 726):

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: = depart from, acc. pers. Ge 44:22, Ge 44:22 (J), 2Ki 2:2, 2Ki 2:4, 2Ki 2:6, 2Ki 4:30, Nu 10:31 (P), Ru 1:16, Je 9:1 (‖[[הָלַךְ מֵאֵת]]); acc. loc. 1Ki 8:6, Je 25:28 (´[[י]] as lion leaving lair); c. [[מִן]] loc. intrans. (strangely) Je 18:14 (of snow).

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: leave behind, acc. pers. Ex 2:20 (J), 2Sa 15:16 (+ inf.), Ez Eze 24:21; acc. rei + [[בְּיַד]] Ge 39:12, Ge 39:13, + [[אֶחְלִי]] v:Ge 39:15, v:Ge 39:18 (all J); + [[ב]] loc. Ge 50:8 (J); acc. pers. et rei Ex 9:21 (J).

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: leave in the presence of ([[לִפְנֵי]]) 1Ch 16:37 ([[ל]] of accus., cf. [[ל]]

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: leave in safety, [[וְאָ֫נׇה חַעַזְבוּ כְּבוֹדְכֶם]] Is 10:3.

definitions.title: e.
definitions.body: leave in a given condition, situation, [[אׂתוֹ בְמַחֲלֻיִים]] ´[[ע]] 2Ch 24:25 they left him in great suffering; c. adv. acc. Ez Eze 23:29; a city [[פְּתוּחָה]] Jos 8:17.

definitions.title: f.
definitions.body: leave undisturbed, let alone Ru 2:16.

definitions.title: g.
definitions.body: leave unexercised, Ge 24:27 pregn. he hath not left his kindness and his faithfulness from (being) with ([[מֵעִם]]) my master; so [[חַסְדּוֹ אֶת־]] ´[[ע]] Ru 2:20 (both of ´[[י]]); [[חֵמָה]] ´[[ע]] Ps 37:8 (‖[[הֶרֶף מֵאַף]]).

definitions.title: h.
definitions.body: leave in the hand of, entrust to, acc. rei + [[בְּיַד]] Ge 39:6 (J), + [[אֶל־]] Job 39:11 (‖[[בָּטַח בְּ]]), + [[עַל־]] Ps 10:14 (acc. om., his cause).—So also poss. (c. [[לְ]]) Ne 3:34 (reading [[לֵאלֽהִים]] for MT [[לָהֶם]]), but text prob. otherwise corrupt.

definitions.title: i.
definitions.body: leave to ([[ל]]) one (unaided), [[וְחָדַלְתָּ֫ מֵעֲזׁב לוֹ]] Ex 23:5 a (E) thou shalt refrain from leaving it (sc. the affair) to him; cf. [[תַּעֲזׁב לָאָרֶץ בֵּיחֶיהָ]] Job 39:14 (of ostrich).

definitions.title: j.
definitions.body: leave over, remaining, acc. pers. Jos 2:21 (JE); acc. rei + [[לְ]] pers. Le 19:10, Le 23:22 (H), Mal Mal 4:1.

definitions.title: k.
definitions.body: leave = have nothing to do with Pr 9:6.
leave, abandon, forsake: †

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: abandon, acc. rei: (1) land, house, city, tent, etc., 1Sa 31:7 = 1Ch 10:7, 2Ki 7:7, Je 9:18, Je 48:28, Je 51:9, 2Ch 11:14, Is 17:9 (+ [[מִפְּנֵי]] of enemy); pt. pass. of cities v:Is 17:2, Je 4:29, Zep 2:4, cf. [[עֲזוּבָה]] Is 17:9 pt. = subst. = deserted region. (2) oxen 1Ki 19:20, idol-images (+ [[שָׁם]]) 2Sa 5:21 = 1Ch 14:12, flock Zec 11:17; pt. pass. of eggs Is 10:14. †

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: forsake, (1) human subj. and obj.: Ge 2:24 (J; a man his parents), 1Sa 30:13, Jos 22:3 (D), Je 49:11, Ps 27:10 (parent a child), Pr 2:17 (wife her husband, [[אַלוּף]]), cf. [[עֲזוּבָה אִשָּׁה]] Is 54:6, and ´[[ע]] of personif. Zion Is 60:15, Is 62:4. (2) an animal its young Je 14:5 (obj. om). †

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: = neglect, Levite De 12:19, De 14:27, poor Job 20:19.

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: esp. (1) fig. of forsaking God (´[[י]]), apostatizing, Ju Jdg 10:10, De 28:20, De 31:16, Je 1:16 + 38 t. (oft. Je and later); + Jon 2:9 (obj. [[חַסְדָּם]], i.e. God, v. [[חֶסֶד]]

definitions.title: II
definitions.body: ); c. [[ל]] + inf. only [[עָֽזְבוּ לִשְׁמׂר]] ´[[אֶת־י]] Ho 4:10 (Oort We Now doubt [[לִשְׁמׂר]]). (2) obj. ´[[י]]'s law, commands, covenant, etc., De 29:24, 1Ki 19:10, 1Ki 19:14 + 14 t.; house of ´[[י]] 2Ch 24:18, Ne 10:40. † (3) forsake, fail to follow, obey advice, instruction, wisdom, reproof: 1Ki 12:8, 1Ki 12:13 = 2Ch 10:8, 2Ch 10:13, Pr 2:13, Pr 4:2, Pr 4:6, Pr 10:17, Pr 15:10, Pr 27:10. † (4) but also of forsaking idols Ez Eze 20:8, sins of various kinds Eze 23:8, Is 55:7, Pr 28:13 (obj. om.; + [[מוֹדֶה]] confess); [[הַמַּשָּׁא]] usury Ne 5:10.

definitions.title: e.
definitions.body: of God's forsaking, abandoning men: De 31:17, Is 42:16, Is 49:14, Is 54:7, 2Ch 12:5, Ezr 9:9, Ps 9:11, Ps 22:2 + 8 t. PsalmPsalm; + [[בְּיַד]] Ne 9:28, Ps 37:33; Ps 16:10 thou wilt not abandon my soul [[לִשְׁאוֹל]]; of temporary abandonment 2Ch 32:31 (+ inf. of purpose); etc. (34 t. in all); + Je 12:7 (´[[י]] abandoning his house). †

definitions.title: f.
definitions.body: of God's leaving, i.e. ceasing to regard, the earth, thus giving impunity to crime, Ez Eze 8:12, Eze 9:9. †

definitions.title: g.
definitions.body: of strength ([[כּׂחַ]]) forsaking one Ps 38:11, courage ([[לֵב]]) Ps 40:13, kindness and faithfulness ([[חֶסֶד וֶאֱמֶת]]) Pr 3:3. †

let loose, set free, let go [[עִמּוֹ עָזׁב תַּעֲזׁב]] Ex 23:5 b (E) thou shalt by all means free it (sc. the beast) with him, (aid him to set it free; on sense, cf. De 22:4; DHM sub II. [[עזב]]); [[עָחוּר וְעָזוּב]] shut up and freed, proverb. phr., = all classes of people De 32:36, 1Ki 14:10, 1Ki 21:21, 2Ki 9:8, 2Ki 14:26 (exact meaning dub.; prob. either = bond and free, or [v. RS:Sem i. 437, 2nd ed. 456] under taboo and free from it); let go Job 20:13 (c, acc. of wickedness as morsel in mouth); let loose my complaint Job 10:1 ([[עָלַי]] apud me, cf. [[עַל]]

definitions.body: ); [[אֶעֶזְבָה פָנַי]] Job 9:27 I will loosen, relax, my face, (cf. Thes De Me Stu Di Buhl:Lex Bu; > abandon my [gloomy] countenance AV RV SS Bae:Kau Du). †
be left to ([[לְ]]), i.e. to the possession of, Is 18:6.
be forsaken, of house of God Ne 13:11, a city Ez Eze 36:4, Is 27:10 (‖[[מְשֻׁלָּח]]), Is 62:12; the earth Job 18:4, land Is 7:16, Le 26:43 (+ [[מִן]] of exiles); of man Ps 37:25. †
